noun.description: A hauling or lifting device consisting of a rope, cable, or chain winding around a horizontal rotating drum, turned by a crank or by motor or other power source; a windlass.
The crank of a wheel or axle.

verb.description: Hoist or haul with a winch.
examples: an attempt to winch survivors of the wreck into a helicopter

origin: Late Old English wince reel, pulley, of Germanic origin; related to the verb wink. The verb dates from the early 16th century.
